page.title: 06THE BEAULY VALLEY-TEANASSIE
page.content: North of the Beauly Valley lies the croft of Lower Leanassie which consists of permanent pasture land interspersed with clumps of coniferous trees and scrubland.Leanassie means flat place by the falls. The River Beauly flows by the side of the main Beauly_Cannich road where two bus services run regulary-a twice weekly service between Cannich and Beauly and a daily service between Inverness and Struy.The South bank of the river is bordered by the Ruttle Wood_a mixture of coniferous trees and scrubland.The road then runs West through the Crask of Aigas,where there is an island in the river called Eilan Aigas,towards the small village of Struy.
